casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Harold Ray ESTES. No. 543P07. Supreme Court of North Carolina. April 10, 2008. J. Matthew Martin, Harry C. Martin, Hillsborough, for Estes. David N. Kirkman, Assistant Attorney General, C. Colon Willoughby, Jr., District Attorney, for State. Prior report: ___ N.C.App. ___, 651 S.E.2d 598 .

ORDER

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal from the North Carolina Court of Appeals, filed by the Defendant on the 8th day of November 2007 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-30, and the motion to dismiss the appeal for lack of substantial constitutional question filed by the State of NC, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the motion to dismiss the appeal is

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 10th day of April 2008."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 8th day of November 2007 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 10th day of April 2008."
